title: Introduction to SpatialQC
text: can return Seurat Object setting seurat=TRUE required files Seurat
code: expMat ="~/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1/cell_feature_matrix/" # Do not return a seurat object  result <- readSpatial(sample_id = "Xenium_test1",path="/Users/yliu08/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1",platform = "Xenium",seurat = FALSE) #> [1] "Reading: Xenium_test1" head(result$Xenium_test1$TxMatrix[1:3]) #>      transcript_id    cell_id overlaps_nucleus feature_name x_location #>              <i64>     <char>            <int>       <char>      <num> #> 1: 282720517227020 UNASSIGNED                0        CENPF   41.53576 #> 2: 282720517227024 UNASSIGNED                0        POSTN  133.33856 #> 3: 282720517227764 UNASSIGNED                0        ACTA2  206.73055 #>    y_location z_location    qv fov_name nucleus_distance #>         <num>      <num> <num>   <char>            <num> #> 1:   12996.95   11.05243    40       Y2         471.3381 #> 2:   12989.56   11.07740    40       Y2         389.7239 #> 3:   12984.05   11.09418    40       Y2         327.9553 # Return a seurat object  # result_seu <- readSpatial(sample_id = "Xenium_test1",path="/Users/yliu08/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1/",platform = "Xenium",seurat = TRUE) # print(result_seu)

title: Introduction to SpatialQC
text: mutliple QC functions, using seurat object input, return dataframe can used generate plot using plot functions.
code: getTxPerCell<- getTxPerCell(expMat="/Users/yliu08/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1/",platform = "Xenium",seu_obj = NULL) getTxPerCell #> [1] 81.8692 getTxPerArea <- getTxPerArea(cellSegMeta="/Users/yliu08/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1/cells.csv.gz",platform = "Xenium",seu_obj = NULL) getTxPerArea #> [1] 0.4526734 getNcells<- getNcells(expMat=expMat,platform = "Xenium",seu_obj = NULL) getNcells #> [1] 436888 getGlobalFDR<- getGlobalFDR(tx_file = "/Users/yliu08/Documents/GitHub/SpatialQM/datasets/Xenium/TOUCHSTONE_UOA_XR_FFPE_BR_1_SYD_C_R1/transcripts.csv.gz",platform = "Xenium",seu_obj = NULL) getGlobalFDR #> [1] 8.721251e-05 getTxPerCell<- getTxPerCell(platform = "Xenium",seu_obj = NULL,expMat=expMat) getTxPerCell #> [1] 81.8692

what: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: SpatialQC, package supports loading Spatial -Situ datasets calculating Quality Control metrics aid understanding data quality.

title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: Spatial omics technologies revolutionizing understand biological tissues, enabling mapping molecular compositions unprecedented spatial resolutions. However, great power comes great complexity. interpretation spatial omics data requires robust quality control measures ensure reliability reproducibility measurements. SpatialQC developed meet need, providing comprehensive suite quality control metrics specifically tailored -situ spatial omics data (e.g CosMx, Xenium).

title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: remotes::install_github('https://github.com/Center--Spatial-OMICs/SpatialQC')

title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: users wanting use annotation functions SpatialQC, Package RCTD & InSituType recommended. install: Notes: Package InSituType needs C++ compiler can installed follows:
code: if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("remotes")   } remotes::install_github("dmcable/RCTD") if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("https://github.com/Nanostring-Biostats/InSituType")

previous_headings: How to install > for dedenpency packages
what: gcc and gfortran are required for Mac users to install InSituType
title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: Add following lines Makevars file: others, please use Rscipts
code: /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" brew install gcc gcc --version mkdir -p ~/.R touch ~/.R/Makevars vi ~/.R/Makevars CC=/opt/homebrew/bin/gcc-14 CXX=/opt/homebrew/bin/g++-14 CXX11=/opt/homebrew/bin/g++-14 CXX14=/opt/homebrew/bin/g++-14 CXX17=/opt/homebrew/bin/g++-14 FC=/opt/homebrew/bin/gfortran-14 F77=/opt/homebrew/bin/gfortran-14

title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: Reads preprocesses spatial transcriptomics data specified path given imaging based platform. function supports ‘Xenium’ ‘CosMx’ platforms, performing platform-specific loading preprocessing steps. includes loading data, annotating sample metadata processing cell metadata. ‘Xenium’, adds additional cell metadata tissue coordinates embedding custom plotting. ‘CosMx’, separates targeting non-targeting probes, adds additional cell metadata includes tissue coordinates embedding. ‘Merscope’ platform support development. Regardless platform, data stored assay named “RNA” convenient platform, table used subsequent functions.

title: QC metrics and support for In-Situ Spatial data across different platforms
text: Reads transcriptome metadata specified path, depending platform specified. Currently supports ‘Xenium’ ‘CosMx’ platforms. ‘Xenium’, reads ‘transcripts.csv.gz’ renames ‘feature_name’ column ‘target’ consistency. ‘CosMx’, reads appropriate transcriptome file matched ‘*tx_file.csv.gz’. ‘Merscope’ platform support development. platform, table used subsequent functions.

title: readSpatial — readSpatial
text: sample_id Identifier sample processed. path file path load spatial transcriptomics data. platform platform data originates. Valid options 'Xenium', 'CosMx', 'Merscope'. Note: 'Merscope' currently supported. seurat Return seurat object .

title: readSpatial — readSpatial
text: Returns Seurat object containing loaded processed spatial transcriptomics data, including sample metadata, cell metadata, embeddings tissue coordinates. structure content returned object vary depending platform.

title: readSpatial — readSpatial
text: Reads preprocesses spatial transcriptomics data specified path given platform. function supports 'Xenium' 'CosMx' platforms, performing platform-specific loading preprocessing steps. includes loading data, annotating sample metadata, processing cell metadata. 'Xenium', adds additional cell metadata tissue coordinates embedding custom plotting. 'CosMx', fixes assays separate targeting non-targeting probes, adds additional cell metadata, includes tissue coordinates embedding. 'Merscope' platform support development.

title: readTxMeta — readTxMeta

title: readTxMeta — readTxMeta

title: readTxMeta — readTxMeta
text: #' function reads transcriptome metadata specified path, depending platform specified. Currently supports 'Xenium' 'CosMx' platforms. 'Xenium', reads 'transcripts.csv.gz' renames 'feature_name' column 'target' consistency. 'CosMx', reads appropriate transcriptome file matched '*tx_file.csv.gz'. 'Merscope' platform support development.
